intro: Rhodanthe microglossa, commonly known as the small-lipped rhytidophyll, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while the flower heads are surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. Rhodanthe microglossa is adapted to dry conditions and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value.
